name: TODO or FIXME Comments in Code
description: Leaving TODO or FIXME comments in code may indicate incomplete or risky implementations.

name: Active Test Endpoints
description: Test or debug routes left accessible in production may reveal sensitive logic.

name: Default or Sample Credentials
description: Default or sample credentials can be easily exploited by attackers.

name: Leaked Database Schema or Metadata
description: Leaking schema definitions or internal DB metadata can assist attackers.

name: Debug or Test Script Committed
description: Debug/test files in repo may contain sensitive data or access points.

name: Committing Binary or Backup Files
description: Binary or backup files should not be version-controlled. They may contain sensitive data.

name: Logging Secrets or Passwords
description: Logging sensitive data like passwords or tokens can lead to severe breaches.

name: Fake Tokens in Code
description: Even placeholder tokens can accidentally be used or mistaken for real ones.

name: Hardcoded IPs or Localhost in Public Code
description: Using localhost or hardcoded IPs may hinder deployment or cause accidental exposure.

name: Version Control Conflict Markers
description: Merge conflict markers committed by accident can break code or expose unresolved issues.
